One of the themes of my speech was # Food Safety. Since 2003, we have developed sustainable programs to combat hunger.
The financing of family agriculture and the guarantee of purchase of its production expand the food supply and income of the rural population.
Programs like # BolsaFamilia and # BrasilSemMiséria guarantee adequate food for the poorest. Food Safety
With these programs, we took Brazil from the FAO Hunger Map and helped 36 million out of extreme poverty. Food Safety
In # G20 and other international fora, Brazil seeks to share these experiences with partner countries. Food Safety
We must combat distorting subsidies that can threaten small farmers who produce food in poor countries. # G20

Since the beginning of 2015, we have implemented measures to ensure fiscal rebalancing and grow back. # G20
Investment in infrastructure is fundamental and we will attract private capital to seek greater efficiency of private resources. # G20
In 2011, private sector participation in infrastructure projects was 1.1% of GDP. By 2018, we want to raise 1.8% of GDP. # G20
In the period 2015-2018, we will invest about R $ 400 billion in logistics: airports, ports, highways and railways. # G20
Growth and job creation are directly related. We created the Job Protection Plan to keep workers in the companies
We are adopting a collective goal of reducing unemployment among young people. Let's invest heavily in their training. # G20
In 2015, we created 906 thousand places in higher education and more than 1 million places in technical education. # G20
At # G20, I am presenting our efforts to return to sustainable growth.
